scenes.background: [Monica] raises an eyebrow after discussing how to define 'urgent' tasks.
scenes.description: Bob shrugs, looking at you. 'We still need to handle these tasks efficiently. What if it happens again?'

options.text: We need to establish clear guidelines and ensure everyone is on the same page.
options.analysis: You show good social skills and self-regulation by suggesting clear guidelines but may lack some motivation to engage directly.

options.text: I can be available for critical tasks, but we need to define our priorities better.
options.analysis: You show responsibility and motivation but might compromise self-regulation and empathy by overcommitting.

options.text: We should train a backup team to handle urgent tasks when primary members are unavailable.
options.analysis: You show empathy and practicality by suggesting a backup team but may come off as less proactive and socially skilled.
